message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Smoking and alcohol intake are both risk factors for breast cancer, so reducing alcohol intake and quitting smoking can reduce the patient's risk. Breastfeeding and monthly self breast exams may also be helpful in reducing risk, but exercise and reducing alcohol intake are more directly related to the risk factors mentioned in the patient's history. Testing for BRCA1 and 2 may be appropriate for patients with a family history of breast cancer, but it is not indicated based on this patient's history.

Testing for BRCA1 and 2 may also be considered based on additional risk factors but is not the best initial recommendation.

Monthly self-breast exams are important, but they are not as effective in reducing the risk of breast cancer compared to lifestyle modifications.
